intro: Cyathea polycarpa, commonly known as the broad-leaf tree fern, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Cyatheaceae. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk covered in persistent, fibrous roots and a crown of large, pinnately compound leaves. The plant is native to Southeast Asia and thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its fronds are typically bright green and can grow up to several meters in length. Cyathea polycarpa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in indoor conditions.
